bioghist.p: Thomas Lask was the poetry editor of the New York Times.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists primarily of correspondence with poets and editors about reviews of volumes of poetry in the New York Times and submission of poems for inclusion in the paper. Notable correspondents include Delmore Schwartz, Allen Ginsberg, Henry Miller, Tambimuttu, Richard Aldridge, and I. A. Richards. Letters from contributors (or would-be contributors) are often unaccompanied by copies of the submitted poems. The collection does include copies of a manuscript by Joseph Brodsky, several printed volumes by Jonathan Williams, and manuscript and typescript poems by a number of other poets. The collection also includes a small batch of letters from Edwin Arlington Robinson to J. Edith Monahan at Macmillan, from 1929-1931, and several biographical and memorial booklets on Robinson. There are also photographs of Charles Reznikoff and his family.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
